newsitem.title: FRANCE: Saudis said still negotiating barley purchase.
newsitem.headline: Saudis said still negotiating barley purchase.

text.p: Saudi Arabia is still negotiating the purchase of 800,000 tonnes of optional-origin barley, traders said on Thursday.
They said they expected the results of Wednesday's tender by the end of the week or early next week.
There were no immediate details on the prices at which the barley was being offered.
Saudi Arabia, the world's top barley importer, seeks 250,000 tonnes for September 25 arrival and 550,000 tonnes for delivery by October 15.

U.S. grain traders said last week the barley was likely to be priced around $150 per tonne and the bulk would probably come from Europe as the United States and Canada faced disadvantages over freight and timing.
